intro: Lijndenia ramiflora, commonly known as the branching flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its attractive, bright red or orange flowers that appear in clusters during the summer months. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. Lijndenia ramiflora thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth rate and showy blooms make it a distinctive addition to tropical and subtropical landscapes.
